Jared – I hope the following is helpful:
Portland, OR - STREET LIGHTING STANDARDS
http://www.portlandonline.com/auditor/index.cfm?a=36174&c=31194 
Vacaville, CA - DESIGN STANDARDS: STREET LIGHTING
http://www.cityofvacaville.com/modules/showdocument.aspx?documentid=777 
Street Lights for Local Roads Report
Pole Spacing starts on Page 8
http://www.lrc.rpi.edu/programs/NLPIP/PDF/VIEW/SR_StreetlightsLocal.pdf 
A Municipal Guide to Converting to LED which includes pole spacing standards
http://www.leotek.com/education/documents/Leotek.LED.Streetlight.Guide.V6-121112.pdf 
Dallas, TX – STREET DEVELOPMENT STANDARDS ROADWAY STANDARDS AND MASTER THOROUGHFARE PLAN
http://fortworthtexas.gov/uploadedFiles/Transportation_and_Public_Works/About_Us/Divisions/Transportation_Planning_and_Development/09_MTPStreetDevtStds.pdf

author: Jared Cobb
text: We received a complaint recently about inadequate street lighting. Does anyone have a policy on the spacing of street lights in residential areas? Thanks for your help!
title: Street Lights
